title: Beware The Slenderman: The case of Anissa Weier and Morgan Geyser
text:
Beware of Slenderman explores the 2014 Slender Man stabbing (Picture: Sky: Rex)

Morgan Geyser and Anissa Weier were both 12-years-old when they attempted to murder their friend to appease the fictional character the Slender Man.

Described as a man with a featureless white face and head, the Slender Man aka the modern-day boogie man, was created on an online fourm and is often seen hiding in woodlands or stalking children.

After reading up about the creepy entity, Wisconsin schoolgirls Geyser and Weier planned and attacked their fellow classmate Payton Leutner in 2014 by stabbing her 19 times.

Sky Crime documentary Beware The Slenderman delves deep into the incident and contains interviews with the families of the would-be murderers.

The one-off film directed by Irene Taylor Bordsky was first released three years ago and was shot over 18 months – let’s take a look back at what happened in the bizarre case.

On May 31, 2014, Geyser and Weier lured their friend Payton, who also goes by the name Bella, into a nearby woods and stabbed her in the legs, torso and arms with a kitchen knife.

They then told their victim they would get help for her but instead, they walked away, with Payton dragging herself to a nearby road where she was found by a cyclist.

Luckily, Payton survived and was in the hospital for seven days following the horrific ordeal and later returned to school.

Meanwhile, the two attackers were found near Interstate 94 shortly after the incident along with the knife they used and were taken in for questioning, where they revealed they were influenced by the Slender Man.

‘He can be anywhere between 6ft to 14ft tall. He doesn’t have a face. His skin is white,’ Weier said in her interview with police.

‘He has these proxies or servants as people would call them,’ she added. ‘And Morgan said, “Hey Anissa, we should be proxies.”

‘I was like, “Okay, how would we do that?” And she said, “We have to kill Bella”.’

The Slenderman is a faceless man

(Picture: Sky)

Weier added: ‘We had to supposedly prove ourselves worthy to Slender.’

In 2017, Weier pleaded guilty to being party to attempted to second-degree homicide, however, a jury found her ‘not guilty by mental disease or defect.’

She was sentenced to 25 years to life, with at least three years locked in confinement and involuntary treatment in a state psychiatric hospital, followed by communal supervision until the age of 37.

Geyser on the other hand, was awarded 40 years, with the same conditions. She will remain in involuntary treatment until the age of 53.

Last year, Weier was sentenced to 40 years under the mental health facility’s supervision.

Meanwhile, Geyser will periodically have the chance to petition for her release from a mental health facility in the future but will remain under institutional care for the duration of the sentence.

The case of the Slender Man stabbing raised many questions, including whether or not the attackers should be tried as children or adults and the influence of media on children.

Beware The Slenderman is available to stream on Sky Atlantic and NOW TV.
